alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 11:15AM EDT until June 29 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT/330 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN GIBSON AND PIKE COUNTIES... At 1015 AM CDT /1115 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain had mainly exited the area. However, additional showers and thunderstorms may impact portions of this area over the next several hours. Automated rain gauges indicated between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain occurred from Petersburg to Oakland City and Spurgeon. Water was reported in homes in Oakland City and may be slow to recede. Flash Flooding remains likely. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oakland City, Petersburg, Winslow, Francisco, Somerville, Hazleton, Spurgeon and Mackey. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
